The Opportunity
Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too?
The Work Itself
Direct the overall execution and completion of concurrently assigned large and/or complex audit projects on a timely basis.
Direct the audit focus to key risks and ensure efficient - effective delivery with the highest quality, in compliance with professional standards and audit policies.
Ensure services provided align with strategic direction and provide value added results.
Review and interpret work papers and analyses presented by team members and consistently draw the right conclusions.
Conduct continuous monitoring and prepare continuous monitoring memos and summaries quarterly.
Ensure completion of audit plan within designated timeframes Inspire and challenge audit teams to achieve excellent performance.
Mentor - develop managers and staff through effective career development planning; act as a knowledge resource.
Effectively address unusual and difficult problems; coach/support managers and staff in the same Assess audit managers and staff against established performance and leadership criteria; provide timely, honest and meaningful project evaluations.
Establish open and effective communication with management and monitor client satisfaction.
Serve as liaison with key IT management in a collaborative way to foster positive working relationships, promote Audit's image, provide control advice and issue trends and to stay abreast of major business activities and changes in the business; and makes appropriate audit plan recommendations.
Support continuous process improvement by identifying needs and opportunities and recommending appropriate process changes; champion common global audit process approach; recommend process changes to maintain the highest quality standards.
Develop/maintain expertise in a specific subject area and champion knowledge transfer to staff.
Assist Audit management, as appropriate in fulfilling information requests from regulators (FRB/FDIC) and represent Ally Audit Services in supporting and handling issues raised by the FRB/FDIC.
Conduct peer reviews of reports from colleagues, providing timely and complete content feedback (rating and writing).
Lead in the development of key strategic objectives and assist in the development of the annual risk assessment and audit plan.
Prepare for and conduct key meetings and presentations with management and/or the audit committee.
Create structured - effective presentations to wider audiences on risk - control matters and other business issues.
The Skills You Bring
9+ years of related experience in auditing, with a large focus on IT, increasing responsibility over time, including directing and leading teams In-depth experience in internal audit, public accounting.
Bachelor's degree in related field (Information Systems, Business, Accounting, or other related field of study).
Higher degree in IT or other related field of study desirable Certified in related field (CISA, CIA, CPA) strongly preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of risk management concepts and relevant risk-based integrated process auditing.
Demonstrated ability for understanding the relationship between audit risk assessment and audit objectives.
Sound communication skills, both verbal and written, to promote report quality and foster positive working relationships with business management.
Strong analytical - problem solving skills.
Multi-tasking experience in a dynamic organization with a detailed oriented with a roll up the sleeves attitude.
Performing risk and control analysis and experience in flowcharting and process mapping.
Proficient in Team Mate, MS-Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Flowcharting software, and Electronic Audit Tools Knowledge of CoBiT, FFIEC, and SOX.
Knowledge of data mining and analytical tools preferred (ACL, IDEA, MS Access).
Public accounting or internal audit background preferred.
Occasional travel (25%) required.
How We'll Have Your Back
Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. But Ally’s total compensation – or total rewards – extends beyond your paycheck and is designed to support and enrich your personal and professional life, including:
Time Away:
Program starts at 17 paid time off days in addition to 12 paid holidays and 8 hours of volunteer time off yearly (time off days are prorated based on start date and program varies based on full or part-time status and management level).
Planning for the Future:
plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading retirement plan with matching and company contributions, tuition reimbursement and employee stock purchase plan.
Supporting your Health & Well-being:
extended health care (paramedical, vision, prescription drug, gender affirmation support), dental, health care spending account funds, life insurance, short and long-term disability coverage, and a well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally, and financially.
Building a Family:
adoption, surrogacy, and fertility support as well as parental and caregiver leave, back-up child and adult/elder day care program.
Who We Are:
Ally Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com.
Ally is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical or mental disabilities. For accommodation requests, email us at hrpolicy@ally.com. Ally will not discriminate against any qualified individual who is capable of performing the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated engineer to support our Cyber Security Platform Performance Engineering team. This role demands a blend of technical expertise, and a proactive approach to support our cybersecurity infrastructure, applications and services ensuring the reliability and security of our environments.
The Work Itself
Develop and maintain automation scripts to support metrics collection, reporting and dashboard creation
Assist in implementing and reporting around operations, monitoring, patch management, and lifecycle management
Collaborate with other cyber security engineering teams to define, automate (self-service), and implement key operations metric’s, KPI’s and dashboard
Responsible for observability to monitor performance and security through metrics, traces and logs. Help to define observability and monitoring metrics such as SLO’s (Service Level objectives) and SLI’s (Service Level Indicators), working toward eliminating inefficiencies through automation and process improvement
Assist in resolving production incidents, escalations, and reporting (RCA’s)
The Skills You Bring
3+ years of experience in reliability engineering, with a focus on SLOs, SLIs, error budgeting, and eliminating toil. Solid experience with incident management, including response, diagnosis, escalation, and reporting, is required
3-5+ years of AWS experience (IAC, performance engineering, testing, automation)
Experience in operations, lifecycle management, patch management, configuration management, release, and QA engineering / automation
Expertise in observability tools and techniques for monitoring metrics, traces, and logs
Proficiency in automation using scripting languages such as GoLang, Python, and PowerShell
Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as GitLab
Familiarity with monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Splunk, and the ELK Stack
Experience with cyber security tools such as firewalls, intrusion prevention (IPS), web application firewalls (WAF), network access control (NAC), endpoint detection and response (EDR), eMail security, and/or data loss prevention (DLP)
